intro: Rebutia diersiana, commonly known as the Dieters' Rebutia, is a species of cactus native to South America, specifically Argentina. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and ribbed structure. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to arid environments. Rebutia diersiana is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
